page.title: 16Social Care D/Worth W. Grove
page.content: A social worker's task in Denchworth is mainly with the aged where she has to find home helps, special aids for arthritis, nursing help etc. She works alongside the health visitors. Together they make sure the elderly are safe, well fed and healthy. Sometimes 'meals on wheels' are provided. In W.Grove her main work is quite different. There she helps find registered childminders for working mothers. Sometimes she needs to place children in need or at risk, with foster parents. Occasionally she helps a handicapped child or takes into care a teenager who has got into trouble. She gives guidance to the unemployed as to the benefits they can claim to help pay their debts. There are, at present, no problem families in Denchworth and only one in W. Grove.
